a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Children per woman that survived childhood vs. those that
The total height of the red and blue areas shows the average number of children born per woman. The area in red shows the
average number of children an average woman gave birth to, who died within the first five years of life.
Data source: OWID calculations based on Gapminder data
